pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 193, 304, 209]]<|/det|>
# FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 154, 231]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF10)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 367, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 500, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 433]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 285, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 507, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of a calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 907, 540]]<|/det|>
Results obtained solely from a graphic calculator, without supporting working or reasoning, will not receive credit.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 606, 586]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 586, 757, 602]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 97, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 433, 114]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\sum_{r = n + 1}^{2n}r^2 = \frac{1}{6} n(2n + 1)(7n + 1).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 918, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 138, 96, 156]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 136, 603, 157]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(a\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 163, 570, 183]]<|/det|>
\[a x + y + 2z = 0,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 183, 570, 202]]<|/det|>
\[3x - 2y = 4,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 202, 576, 222]]<|/det|>
\[3x - 4y - 6az = 14,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 295, 244]]<|/det|>
has a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 225, 918, 244]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 275, 96, 295]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 268, 920, 319]]<|/det|>
Let \(S_{N} = \frac{1}{2!} + \frac{2}{3!} + \frac{3}{4!} + \ldots + \frac{N}{(N + 1)!}\). Prove by mathematical induction that, for all positive integers \(N\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 319, 576, 354]]<|/det|>
\[S_{N} = 1 - \frac{1}{(N + 1)!}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 325, 920, 345]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 384, 92, 403]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 382, 920, 422]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors \(\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k}\), \(2\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j} + 5\mathbf{k}\) and \(2\mathbf{i} + 3\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k}\) respectively. Find \(\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 405, 920, 424]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 434, 455, 454]]<|/det|>
Deduce, in either order, the exact value of

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 459, 146, 478]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 459, 390, 479]]<|/det|>
the area of the triangle \(ABC\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 484, 151, 503]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 484, 489, 503]]<|/det|>
the perpendicular distance from \(C\) to \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 500, 920, 518]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 545, 94, 565]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 545, 779, 565]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = 1 + 2\cos \theta\). Sketch the curve for \(- \frac{2}{3}\pi \leqslant \theta < \frac{2}{3}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 579, 626, 599]]<|/det|>
Find the area bounded by \(C\) and the half-lines \(\theta = - \frac{1}{3}\pi\), \(\theta = \frac{1}{3}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 580, 920, 599]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 626, 96, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 625, 426, 644]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 650, 591, 672]]<|/det|>
\[x = t^{2},\quad y = \frac{1}{4} t^{4} - \ln t,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 677, 920, 714]]<|/det|>
for \(1 \leqslant t \leqslant 2\). Find the area of the surface generated when \(C\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 696, 920, 714]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 740, 96, 759]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 740, 500, 759]]<|/det|>
A cubic equation has roots \(\alpha\), \(\beta\) and \(\gamma\) such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 765, 562, 784]]<|/det|>
\[\alpha + \beta + \gamma = 4,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 784, 571, 804]]<|/det|>
\[\alpha^{2} + \beta^{2} + \gamma^{2} = 14,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 804, 571, 824]]<|/det|>
\[\alpha^{3} + \beta^{3} + \gamma^{3} = 34.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 829, 376, 848]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\alpha \beta + \beta \gamma + \gamma \alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 831, 920, 848]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 860, 373, 878]]<|/det|>
Show that the cubic equation is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 878, 581, 898]]<|/det|>
\[x^{3} - 4x^{2} + x + 6 = 0,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 904, 311, 922]]<|/det|>
and solve this equation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 905, 920, 923]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 384, 92]]<|/det|>
Let \(\mathrm{z} = \cos \theta +\mathrm{i}\sin \theta\). Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[363, 98, 636, 120]]<|/det|>
\[1 + z = 2\cos {\frac{1}{2}}\theta (\cos {\frac{1}{2}}\theta +\mathrm{i}\sin {\frac{1}{2}}\theta). \quad (3)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 136, 776, 158]]<|/det|>
By considering \((1 + z)^{n}\), where \(n\) is a positive integer, deduce the sum of the series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[327, 163, 670, 194]]<|/det|>
\[\binom{n}{1}\sin \theta +\binom{n}{2}\sin 2\theta +\ldots +\binom{n}{n}\sin n\theta . \quad (6)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 240, 96, 258]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 230, 803, 265]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation \(y = \frac{x^{2} - 3x + 3}{x - 2}\). Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 240, 917, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 574, 293]]<|/det|>
Show that there are no points on \(C\) for which \(-1 < y < 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 274, 917, 293]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 304, 495, 325]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the turning points of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 305, 917, 324]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 336, 201, 355]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 337, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 383, 102, 401]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 381, 920, 428]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation \(x^{3} + y^{3} = 3xy\), for \(x > 0\) and \(y > 0\). Find a relationship between \(x\) and \(y\) when \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 408, 917, 427]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 438, 910, 460]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the turning point of \(C\), and determine the nature of this turning point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 457, 917, 475]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 504, 107, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 497, 645, 532]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int x\big(1 - x^{2}\big)^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathrm{d}x = - \frac{1}{3}\big(1 - x^{2}\big)^{\frac{3}{2}} + c\), where \(c\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 505, 917, 524]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 545, 556, 585]]<|/det|>
Given that \(I_{n} = \int_{0}^{1}x^{n}\big(1 - x^{2}\big)^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathrm{d}x\), prove that, for \(n \geqslant 2\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 590, 591, 611]]<|/det|>
\[(n + 2)I_{n} = (n - 1)I_{n - 2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 588, 917, 607]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 628, 455, 647]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(x = \sin u\) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 650, 583, 685]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{1}(1 - x^{2})^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathrm{d}x = \frac{1}{4}\pi .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[887, 658, 917, 677]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 705, 185, 724]]<|/det|>
Find \(I_{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 702, 920, 721]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 526, 92]]<|/det|>
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 201, 138]]<|/det|>
# EITHER

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 152, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
The vector \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of each of the \(n\times n\) matrices \(\mathbf{A}\) and \(\mathbf{B}\), with corresponding eigenvalues \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\) respectively. Prove that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{AB}\) with eigenvalue \(\lambda \mu\). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 197, 400, 216]]<|/det|>
It is given that the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 221, 591, 275]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 & 2 & 2 \\ -2 & -2 & -2 \\ 1 & 2 & 2 \end{pmatrix},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 280, 707, 330]]<|/det|>
has eigenvectors \(\left( \begin{array}{c}0\\ 1\\ -1 \end{array} \right)\) and \(\left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ 0\\ -1 \end{array} \right)\). Find the corresponding eigenvalues.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 297, 920, 315]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 338, 702, 357]]<|/det|>
Given that 2 is also an eigenvalue of \(\mathbf{A}\), find a corresponding eigenvector.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 339, 920, 358]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 370, 288, 388]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{B}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 388, 591, 443]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} -1 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 2 \\ -3 & -6 & -6 \end{pmatrix},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 443, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
has the same eigenvectors as \(\mathbf{A}\). Given that \(\mathbf{AB} = \mathbf{C}\), find a non-singular matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 477, 551, 497]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{P}^{-1}\mathbf{C}^2\mathbf{P} = \mathbf{D}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 477, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 530, 153, 549]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 562, 556, 581]]<|/det|>
Obtain the general solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[383, 586, 616, 618]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +6\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +13x = 75\cos 2t.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 597, 920, 616]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 642, 603, 670]]<|/det|>
Given that \(x = 5\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0\) when \(t = 0\), find \(x\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 648, 920, 667]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 682, 673, 701]]<|/det|>
Show that, for large positive values of \(t\) and for any initial conditions,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 708, 569, 728]]<|/det|>
\[x\approx 5\cos (2t - \phi),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 734, 462, 753]]<|/det|>
where the constant \(\phi\) is such that \(\tan \phi = \frac{4}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 734, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
